subject: Communication
title: Cultural Conflict Styles Around the World
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cultural Conflict Styles Around the World.

hook.text: An American manager's direct confrontation style baffled the Japanese team. In Tokyo, silence is the loudest protest.

buildup.text: Cultures differ dramatically in preferred conflict styles. Western cultures favor direct confrontation; many Asian.

discovery.text: Ting-Toomey's face-negotiation theory: collectivist cultures protect 'face' (social dignity) during conflict.

twist.text: Neither approach is superior. Direct confrontation solves problems fast but damages relationships.

climax.text: Global teams must negotiate not just the conflict itself, but the conflict style to use. Meta-conflict is real.

punchline.text: Before resolving conflict, agree on how to have one.

quiz.question: What does face-negotiation theory address?
options: How cultures protect social dignity during disagreements
